problem_text:
We say that an element u of a group G is a test element if for any endomorphism φ of G the equality φ(u) = u implies that φ is an automorphism of G. Does a free soluble group of rank 2 and derived length d > 2 have any test elements?
B. Fine, V. Shpilrain
answer: Yes, it does (E. I. Timoshenko, Algebra and Logic, 45, no. 4 (2006), 254–260.)
